definition: to break (e.g. stick or bone)/a loss
to turn sth over/to turn upside down/to tip sth out (of a container)

to break/to fracture/to snap/to suffer loss/to bend/to twist/to turn/to change direction/convinced/to convert into (currency)/discount/rebate/tenth (in price)/classifier for theatrical scenes/to fold/accounts book

sentences.english: A figure entering at the door threw a shadow on Madame Defarge whichshe felt to be a new one.
sentences.chinese: 一个人影踅进门来，影子投在德伐日太太身上。

sentences.english: On my return, I scouted round to find a good location to set up my shop.
sentences.chinese: 回来后，我踅摸了一圈，找到了一个开店的好地方。

sentences.english: Shasta strolled over to it and patted its neck.
sentences.chinese: 沙斯塔踅过去，拍拍马儿的颈子。

sentences.english: I walked up and down the beach and kept looking.
sentences.chinese: 我在海边走来走去地踅摸。

sentences.english: Her friend is stung by a jellyfish and dies.
sentences.chinese: 结果她的朋友被水母踅死了。

definition: to turn back/to retrace one's steps
to throw a glance at/to peer at/Taiwan pr. [jun4]
to limp/to sprain (an ankle or wrist)/to move carefully, as if evading a danger/to scurry
to walk on tiptoe/to step on sb's foot/to join (a trade, profession etc)/to associate with (a certain group of people)
to walk on tiptoe/to walk quietly/to tread (on)/to follow
